skill.name: frontend-dev-guidelines
skill.description: Frontend development guidelines for React/TypeScript applications. Modern patterns including Suspense, lazy loading, useSuspenseQuery, file organization with features directory, MUI v7 styling, TanStack Router, performance optimization, and TypeScript best practices. Use when creating components, pages, features, fetching data, styling, routing, or working with frontend code.
skill.summary: Frontend development guidelines for React/TypeScript applications. Modern patterns including Suspens...

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing markdown files with TypeScript code examples. No executable code, network operations, file system access, or external dependencies. All content is descriptive guidelines for React/TypeScript development patterns.

content.value_statement: Writing React/TypeScript frontend code without consistent patterns leads to maintenance issues and bugs. This skill provides comprehensive development guidelines with code examples for components, data fetching, routing, styling, and performance optimization using modern React patterns.
actual_capabilities: Create React components using React.FC pattern with TypeScript
Implement data fetching with useSuspenseQuery and cache-first strategy
Set up file organization with features directory pattern
Style components using MUI v7 sx prop with type-safe styles
Configure routing with TanStack Router folder-based structure
Handle loading states with SuspenseLoader and error boundaries
limitations: Does not generate production code or scaffold entire applications
Does not execute or test code - provides guidelines only
Does not integrate with build tools or bundlers
Focused on React/TypeScript - not applicable to other frontend frameworks

best_practices: Use React.FC<Props> pattern for all components with explicit TypeScript interfaces
Wrap lazy-loaded components in SuspenseLoader to prevent layout shift
Implement cache-first data fetching strategy using useSuspenseQuery before API calls
anti_patterns: Never use early returns with loading spinners - causes layout shift
Never use react-toastify - use useMuiSnackbar for notifications
Never use any type in TypeScript - use specific types or unknown

faq.question: Which TypeScript version and settings are supported?
faq.answer: Strict mode enabled with noImplicitAny and strictNullChecks. Use import type for type-only imports.

faq.question: What are the performance limits for component complexity?
faq.answer: Split components over 300 lines. Use inline styles under 100 lines, separate file for more.

faq.question: How does this integrate with existing MUI components?
faq.answer: Use sx prop exclusively with SxProps<Theme> type. MUI v7 Grid uses size prop, not xs/md props.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using these patterns?
faq.answer: Patterns are documentation only. No external data access, network calls, or code execution occurs.

faq.question: Why is my component flickering during loading?
faq.answer: You are using early returns with loading spinners. Wrap component in SuspenseLoader instead.

faq.question: How does this compare to create-react-app or Vite templates?
faq.answer: These are coding pattern guidelines that work with any React build tool. Patterns cover code quality.
